oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Decidability in the logic of subsequences and supersequences
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Karandikar, Prateek
Schnoebelen, Philippe
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Computer Science - Logic in Computer Science
Computer Science - Formal Languages and Automata Theory
F.4.1
F.4.3
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider first-order logics of sequences ordered by the subsequence ordering, aka sequence embedding. We show that the \Sigma_2 theory is undecidable, answering a question left open by Kuske. Regarding fragments with a bounded number of variables, we show that the FO2 theory is decidable while the FO3 theory is undecidable.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 35th IARCS Annual Conference on Foundations of Software Technology and Theoretical Computer Science (FSTTCS 2015)
